Class HangmanManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • HangmanManager

  • public class HangmanManager
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HangmanManager(java.util.List<java.lang.String> dictionary, int length, int max)
      Default constructor that takes a List of words to use for hangman, an int length to decide which length words to pick from, and int max to track how many guesses are remaining.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.Character> guesses()
      Returns a sorted set of characters already guessed by the player.
      int guessesLeft()
      Returns the current guesses remaining for the player.
      java.lang.String pattern()
      Returns the pattern string with white space seperating each character ex: "- e - -" instead of "-e--".
      int record(char guess)
      Takes a guessed character, archives it in the guessed sorted set, checks if already guessed, then chooses the new set of words to use and returns the number of occurences of the guessed character, either 0 or more.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> words()
      Returns the current set of words being used for guessing.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HangmanManager

        public HangmanManager(java.util.List<java.lang.String> dictionary,
                      int length,
                      int max)
        Default constructor that takes a List of words to use for hangman, an int length to decide which length words to pick from, and int max to track how many guesses are remaining.
        Parameters:
        dictionary - the list of words to create the initial set of words
        length - the length of the words to intially pick from
        max - the remaining amount of guesses to start with
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length < 1 or max < 0
        Precondition:
        List must not be empty., length > 0, max >= 0

    • Method Detail

      • words

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> words()
        Returns the current set of words being used for guessing.
        Returns:
        curSet
        Postcondition:
        list.size() > 0

      • guessesLeft

        public int guessesLeft()
        Returns the current guesses remaining for the player.
        Returns:
        guessesRemaining
        Postcondition:
        guessesRemaining >= 0

      • guesses

        public java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.Character> guesses()
        Returns a sorted set of characters already guessed by the player.
        Returns:
        guessed

      • pattern

        public java.lang.String pattern()
        Returns the pattern string with white space seperating each character ex: "- e - -" instead of "-e--".
        Returns:
        current pattern string with characters seperated by whitespace
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if current set of words is empty (size < 0)
        Postcondition:
        String characters are space seperated with no beginning or trailing space

      • record

        public int record(char guess)
        Takes a guessed character, archives it in the guessed sorted set, checks if already guessed, then chooses the new set of words to use and returns the number of occurences of the guessed character, either 0 or more.
        Parameters:
        guess - the character guessed by the player
        Returns:
        the number of occurences of the guessed character (int 0 or more)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if char guessed is was already guessed
        Precondition:
        Character must be lower-case
        Postcondition:
        returned occurences >= 0
